column1: The Central United States is sometimes conceived as between the Eastern and Western as part of a three-region model
column2: roughly coincident with the U.S. Census' definition of the Midwestern United States plus the western and central portions of the U.S. Census' definition of the Southern United States. The Central States are typically considered to consist of North Dakota
column21: Mississippi and Alabama. Chicago is the area's largest city and metropolitan area
column22: other large cities with large metropolitan areas would be Houston

column1: 4 of 9 Census Bureau Divisions have names containing "Central"
column2: though they are not grouped as a region. They include 20 states and 39.45% of the US population as of July 1
column3: 2007.Almost all of the area is in the Gulf of Mexico drainage basin and most of that is in the Mississippi Basin. Small areas near the Great Lakes drain into the Great Lakes and eventually the St. Lawrence River; the Red River Basin is centered on the North Dakota-Minnesota border and drains to Hudson Bay.

column1: The Central Time Zone is the same area plus the Florida Panhandle
column5: westernmost fringes of Great Plains states

column1: Floods have been a problem for the region during the 20th and early-21st century.
== Central regions defined by organizations ==
Different organizations define the central regions of the United States in a variety of ways:
YPO Only 6 central states of the Midwest
CERI All of Midwest and South including MD
NOAA Midwest minus OH
HSUS Midwest minus ND
USGS West North Central States
Adventure Camp Midwest plus South minus Atlantic states
Geography of the Interior United States
National League Central Division
American League Central Division
National Basketball Association Central Division
National Hockey League Central Division
Former National Football Conference Central Division
Former American Football Conference Central Division
== Geographic center of the United States ==
The geographic midpoint of the contiguous 48 states of the United States falls within the boundaries of the Central United States and is located about two miles northwest of Lebanon
column2: Kansas. The spot is located at 39 degrees 50 minutes latitude and 98 degrees 35 minutes longitude.
